adverb.description: In a way that creates a thin piece or layer of something.
examples: thinly spread mustard over the meat
a board covered thinly with flour

adverb.description: With little flesh or fat on the body.
examples: he was tall and thinly built

adverb.description: With few parts or people relative to the area covered or filled; sparsely.
examples: people were thinly spread throughout the square

adverb.description: In a way that lacks strength, substance, or quality; weakly.
examples: the sun shines only thinly through a veil of water
a mishmash of thinly sketched characters
